document.discussion_title: Matthew McConaughey and Camila Alves cheer on Michael Phelps as he takes 22nd gold medal
document.topic_text:
View comments They've been committed supporters of the Rio Olympics since day one. And Matthew McConaughey and Camila Alves are continuing to show their enthusiasm for the Games, as they were spotted in the stands for Michael Phelps' latest winning swim on Thursday evening. The beaming 46-year-old Dallas Buyers Club actor was so excited he had to stand up to cheer on the pool-bound Americans several times throughout the event. Dedicated: Matthew McConaughey and Camila Alves are continuing to show their enthusiasm for the Games, as they were spotted in the stands for Michael Phelps' latest winning swim on Thursday evening A grey newsboy cap, long-sleeve grey sweater and khakis rounded out his fanboy ensemble. Though he wasn't dressed in the red, white and blue he has been seen wearing at other venues, he still opted to show a little Olympic spirit by decorating his identification lanyard with numerous Olympic-themed pins. Matthew was all smiles as he watched the swimmers take to the pool Her long, wavy brunette locks were pushed over to her right side, while she kept her make-up to a minimum, save for a dab of pale rose lipstick. After witnessing Phelps' record 22nd medal win, the couple decided to keep things casual as they went for a romantic dinner date. Even though it must have been quite enjoyable some time together without the family, after dinner the duo still decided to take a few pictures with eager fans. 'It's the first time I've been to the Olympics, actually,' the True Detective actor told CBC . Nodding to the fact that his wife was born in the host country, he said, 'We're always looking for a reason to be here and this gave us a really good reason.' Flying in the face of the ferocious criticism the Games' hosts have gotten, the Interstellar star insisted, 'I think Rio and Brazil's doing a good job of hosting. Garnering a crowd: Camila is also quite famous in Brazil, albeit as a model
